description: {"blocks":[{"key":"f19r","text":"The yeast Pichia pastoris is used widely to biomanufacture high-value recombinant proteins. Its cells can secrete copious quantities of post-translationally modified proteins. Currently, however, heterologous genes must first be integrated into the genome in order to achieve expression.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f2u9n","text":"We produced a synthetic 'chromosome-like' construct called here nanochromosome, an autonomously replicating and mitotically stable synthetic construct expressing heterologous genes. The nanochromosome contains essential scaffolding features as telomeres, centromere and yeast replication origins along with a versatile platform for genetic engineering. This platform could be used for the accurate and controlled insertion of multiple expression cassettes placed on 'landing pad',  in which an array of genes of interest alternate with ~1kp non-coding DNA sequences (LHR) chosen to facilitate simultaneous  double cross-overhomologous recombination and serve as spacers. The landing zone translates along the nanochromosome in an inchworming mode of sequential gene integrations that recycles a pair of antibiotic-resistance markers","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"facst","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"60gu2","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8ftnj","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ct3u","text":"Module with expression cassettes and LHR spacers as a pre-prepared in-vitro assembled DNA parts (insertion or integration arrays) is delivered to Pichia by transformation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4p091","text":"Both the “integration” (receptor) and “insertion” (donor) arrays referred to herein consist of long, HR-ready, regions (LHRs) alternating with gene-expression cassettes. We constructed array parts containing either two or three LHRs e.g.LHRn-GoIn-AMRH/Z-LHRZ or LHRn-GoIn-LHRm-AMRH/Z-LHRZ, respectively, wherein: LHRn, LHRm and LHRZ are unique sequences of ~1000 bp from a library of LHRsA-Z, with LHRZ reserved as the last LHR in the array; GoIn  is a cassette consisting of a gene-of-interest with promoter and terminator regions; and AMRZ/H is a zeocin-resistance gene or hygromycin-resistance gene also with promoter and terminator regions. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":240,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":245,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":250,"length":3},{"style":"sup","offset":257,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":265,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":270,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":275,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":280,"length":3},{"style":"sup","offset":287,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":316,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":322,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":331,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":388,"length":3},{"style":"sup","offset":401,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":445,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":540,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"au68s","text":"Preparation of ZeoR-LHRZ and HygR-LHRZ pair tandems in separate protocol https://www.protocols.io/view/preparation-of-parts-hygr-lhrz-and-zeor-lhrz-cqujvwun","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":73,"length":83}],"data":{}},{"key":"5070g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"83q91","text":"The protocol for multi-DNA parts arrays preparation is based on combinatory assembly and molecular biology techniques customised to create a DNA parts (arrays) library in pUC19 plasmid.
